snippet: Many Syrian rebels have adopted some of the chillingly ruthless tactics of the government, raising the prospect that a military strike could strengthen extremists.
abstract: Many Syrian rebels are adopting brutal and ruthless tactics of government, raising prospect that American military intervention could inadvertently strengthen Islamic extremists and criminals; while United States says it seeks policies that will strengthen secular rebels and isolate extremists, much concern among American officials is focused on two rebel groups that acknowledge ties to Al Qaeda.

byline.contributor: Karam Shoumali contributed reporting from Antakya, Turkey; Anne Barnard from Beirut, Lebanon; and Michael R. Gordon from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Many Syrian rebels have adopted some of the chillingly ruthless tactics of the government, raising the prospect that a military strike could strengthen extremists.

headline.main: Brutality of Syrian Rebels Posing Dilemma in West
headline.print_headline: Rebel Brutality in Syria Posing Dilemma in West

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
